com.xtructure.xneat.evolution.impl
Class NEATSpeciationStrategyImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.xtructure.xevolution.evolution.impl.AbstractEvolutionObject
      com.xtructure.xneat.evolution.impl.AbstractNEATSpeciationStrategy<GeneMap>
          com.xtructure.xneat.evolution.impl.NEATSpeciationStrategyImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
EvolutionObject, NEATSpeciationStrategy<GeneMap>
public class NEATSpeciationStrategyImpl
extends AbstractNEATSpeciationStrategy<GeneMap>

NEATSpeciationStrategyImpl implements the NEATSpeciationStrategy interface for use on NEATGenomes with data payloads of type GeneMap, providing functionality for partitioning a given NEATPopulation into species.

Calls to respeciate(Population) will adjust the NEATPopulation.COMPATIBILITY_THRESHOLD_ATTRIBUTE_ID attribute, increasing it if there are too many species and decreasing it if there are too few.

Compatibility is calculated between two GeneMaps as follows:

  1. the weights of links with matching Innovations are summed.
  2. the number of non-matching interior links are counted. interior links are those not at the end of the list of links sorted by Innovation.
  3. the number of non-matching end links are counted. exterior links are those at the end of the list of links started by Innovation.
  4. those sums are multiplied by NEATEvolutionFieldMap.compatibilityWeightDeltaCoefficient(), NEATEvolutionFieldMap.compatibilityDisjointCoefficient(), and NEATEvolutionFieldMap.compatibilityExcessCoefficient(), respectively.
  5. the sum of those products is the compatibility of the two GeneMap s.

Author:
Luis Guimbarda

findClosestSpecies

private XId findClosestSpecies(Genome<GeneMap> genome,
                               NEATPopulation<GeneMap> population,
                               double compatibilityThreshold)
Returns the species from among the given set of species whose compatibility is most below the compatibility threshold. The comparisons are made with a species most fit genome (or a random genome of the fittest is not known).

Parameters:
genome - the genome to compare
population - the population containing the collection of species to compare
compatibilityThreshold - the threshold for compatibility, below which a genome is considered compatible with a species
Returns:
the most compatible species, or null if no species is compatible
